article_title: Idaho lawmakers advance new health care plan, kill tax cut bill
article_text:
Significant steps on two major session initiatives

Health plan still in works, to be heard Monday

An Idaho-specific managed-care program for 78,000 in gap group expected

article_metadata.news-keywords: Idaho Legislature, Medicaid expansion, healthcare, health care, 78,000, gap group, Fred Wood, Kelley Packer, Mike Moyle, tax cut
article_metadata.description: With a week left in the session, committees in both houses of the Idaho Legislature took significant steps on health care and tax cuts Thursday. A House panel moved forward on a new health insurance proposal for the state’s 78,000 uninsured, while Senate lawmakers killed a bill that would reduce the state’s top income tax rates. The new healthcare plan will be heard Monday.
article_metadata.title: Idaho lawmakers advance new health care plan, kill tax cut bill | Idaho Statesman
